profile.name: Michael Gary Scott
profile.summary: Long-tenured paper-industry leader with a career beginning April 1992 at Dunder Mifflin and culminating in years as regional manager of the Scranton branch. Recognized in-episode for elite sales performance (Top Salesman awards), high-impact client acquisition, and branch performance strong enough to draw corporate attention. Demonstrated entrepreneurial initiative by founding a competing paper company and negotiating a return-to-company outcome that included reinstatement and benefits. Known for high-energy culture programming, internal awards events, and extensive creative output (film, parody songwriting).

custom_sections_json.title: Career Highlights & Accomplishments
custom_sections_json.body:
Sales & Revenue Impact: Earned Top Salesman of the Year awards (1996, 1997).
Sales & Revenue Impact: Claimed responsibility for roughly half of branch clients.
Sales & Revenue Impact: Secured a major client through unorthodox methods during a high-stakes pitch.
Leadership & Operations: Led the branch during its best-performing period and delivered a corporate lecture tour.
Leadership & Operations: Negotiated reinstatement and benefits for a three-person team after launching a competitor.
Leadership & Operations: Accepted a co-manager structure to retain key talent.
Entrepreneurship & Negotiation: Founded the Michael Scott Paper Company and forced a corporate buyout decision.
Marketing & Promotions: Produced an alternate local TV commercial and debuted it internally.
Marketing & Promotions: Launched the Golden Ticket discount program and managed executive escalation.
Culture & Events Leadership: Created and hosted The Dundies awards program.
Community: Organized a tsunami relief fun-raiser.
Community: Scott's Tots tuition pledge initiative; later delivered an accountability visit and partial support.

custom_sections_json.title: Marketing & Promotions Portfolio
custom_sections_json.body:
Local TV Commercial (Alternate Cut) - produced a complete Dunder Mifflin spot with custom animation.
Golden Ticket Discount Program - conceived customer discount promotion and managed executive scrutiny.
Relationship-forward client outreach scripts and phone campaigns.

custom_sections_json.title: Publications & Creative Works
custom_sections_json.body:
Somehow I Manage - management book drafted and later gifted as a physical copy.
Threat Level: Midnight - feature film written, shot, re-shot, edited, and screened.
Song parodies and original comedy songs performed across events.
Self-reported HBO comedy special: Here I Go Again...

custom_sections_json.title: Community & Service
custom_sections_json.body:
Scott's Tots - 10-year tuition pledge; returned to provide partial remedies and accountability.
Tsunami Relief Fun-raiser - morale-oriented fundraising event tied to The Dundies.

custom_sections_json.title: Awards & Recognition
custom_sections_json.body:
Top Salesman of the Year awards (1996, 1997).
Branch best-performing recognition and HQ inquiry.
Performance bonus: $3,000 tied to budget outcomes.

custom_sections_json.title: Additional Notable Facts
custom_sections_json.body:
Childhood appearance on Fundle Bundle.
Hockey participation with a claimed scoring record.
Completed a 25 push-up challenge plus one modified push-up.
Tenure claimed as 9,986,000 minutes at Dunder Mifflin (start April 1992).

custom_sections_json.title: US Continuity - ATS Version
custom_sections_json.body:
Summary: Paper-industry manager and sales leader since 1992; Top Salesman awards; best-performing branch leadership; competitor founded and negotiated return with benefits.
Core Strengths: Sales leadership, negotiation, culture-building, marketing experimentation, creative production.
Experience: Dunder Mifflin Scranton - regional manager; hosted The Dundies; led best-performing branch.
Experience: Michael Scott Paper Company - founder; captured core clients; negotiated buyout.
Experience: Dunder Mifflin Sales - Top Salesman 1996/1997; major client win.
Selected Projects: Alternate local TV commercial; Threat Level: Midnight; Somehow I Manage.
Education/Training: Improv class participation; no completed college.

custom_sections_json.title: UK Continuity - David Brent
custom_sections_json.body:
General manager of Wernham Hogg - Slough branch; later traveling salesman after dismissal.
Accepted a promotion to avoid downsizing, then reversed after a medical exam.
Performed original music on-screen including Freelove Freeway.
Leveraged documentary notoriety into paid appearances.
Cross-version appearances in US series: The Seminar and Search Committee.

custom_sections_json.title: UK Continuity - ATS Version
custom_sections_json.body:
Summary: Wernham Hogg general manager turned traveling salesman; onscreen original music; documentary-driven visibility.
Experience: Wernham Hogg - Slough Branch (General Manager).
Experience: Traveling Sales - post-dismissal (Christmas Specials).
Highlights: Promotion accepted then reversed; Freelove Freeway performance; US series appearances.

custom_sections_json.title: References
custom_sections_json.body: Available upon request (Scranton branch staff; Dunder Mifflin corporate leadership; Michael Scarn's robot butler).

experience.company: Dunder Mifflin Paper Company - Scranton Branch
experience.description: Led branch operations, sales leadership, and culture programs.
bullets: Led the branch during a best-performing period and delivered a corporate lecture tour.
Negotiated reinstatement and benefits for a three-person team after launching a competitor.
Created and hosted The Dundies awards to reinforce culture and retention.
Produced an alternate local TV commercial and coordinated creative assets.
Launched the Golden Ticket promotion and managed executive escalation.

experience.description: Built a competitor, captured core clients, and negotiated a return-to-company deal.
bullets: Captured a majority of branch clients, forcing a corporate buyout decision.
Negotiated return-to-company terms with benefits instead of a cash payout.

experience.description: Account executive focused on client acquisition and retention.
bullets: Secured a major client through a high-stakes pitch.
Maintained a large share of branch clients; claimed half of the client base.
Converted hesitant prospects through persistent relationship-first outreach.

experience.description: Supplemental income role taken during personal debt period.
bullets: Balanced dual roles while maintaining full-time sales responsibilities.

education.degree: Improv Training (Certificate; performance and sketch work)
education.description: Completed improv class as shown in E-Mail Surveillance.

education.degree: Leadership Development (Internal seminar; coaching, budgeting, HR basics)
education.description: Branch leadership program for regional managers.

education.degree: Business Coursework (unfinished; tuition lost to pyramid scheme)
bullets: Intro to business and sales basics (partial).

founder_roles.description: Independent paper company built to compete with former employer.
bullets: Recruited a three-person team and built a client list quickly.
Negotiated acquisition terms to preserve jobs and benefits.
